Plot

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/plot.R
plot.Rd

Plot

# S4 method for MCMC,missing
plot(
  x,
  calendar = c("BCAD", "BP"),
  density = TRUE,
  n = 512,
  interval = c("ci", "hpdi"),
  level = 0.95,
  decreasing = TRUE,
  elapsed = FALSE,
  origin = 1,
  ...
)

# S4 method for PhasesMCMC,missing
plot(
  x,
  calendar = c("BCAD", "BP"),
  level = 0.95,
  n = 512,
  decreasing = TRUE,
  elapsed = FALSE,
  origin = 1,
  succession = is_ordered(x),
  ...
)

Arguments

x

An MCMC or a PhasesMCMC object.
calendar

A character string specifying whether the dates should be displayed in BP or BC/AD. It must be one of "BCAD" (the default) or "BP". Any unambiguous substring can be given.
density

A logical scalar: should estimated density be plotted?
n

An integer specifying the number of equally spaced points at which the density is to be estimated (should be a power of two). Only used if density is TRUE.
interval

A character string specifying the confidence interval to be drawn. It must be one of "ci" (credible interval; the default) or "hpdi" (highest posterior density interval). Any unambiguous substring can be given.
level

A length-one numeric vector giving the confidence level.
decreasing

A logical scalar: should the sort order be decreasing?
elapsed

A logical scalar: should an elapsed time scale be used?
origin

A length-one numeric vector giving the position of the column corresponding to the event from which elapsed time is calculated. Only used if elapsed is TRUE.
...

Extra parameters to be passed to stats::density().
succession

A logical scalar: should time ranges be plotted instead of densities?

Methods (by class)

  • x = MCMC,y = missing: Plots of credible intervals or HPD regions of a series of events.

  • x = PhasesMCMC,y = missing: Plots the characteristics of a group of events (phase).

See also

stats::density()

Author

A. Philippe, M.-A. Vibet, T. S. Dye, N. Frerebeau

Examples

## Coerce to MCMC
events <- as_mcmc(Events, iteration = 1)
summary(events)

#>                mean        sd      min         q1    median         q3
#> Event.2   -637.9158 270.53856 -1348.66  -888.9817  -657.737  -386.2120
#> Event.1  -1785.1308  98.95886 -1999.99 -1856.6725 -1784.640 -1719.0675
#> Event.22  -656.0726  90.62400 -1229.22  -716.6123  -672.340  -610.9733
#> Event.12 -1235.5136  86.03571 -1863.97 -1288.5175 -1235.085 -1180.9425
#>                 max  CI_lower  CI_upper
#> Event.2    -5.14937 -1046.370  -202.127
#> Event.1  -971.03900 -1981.050 -1610.600
#> Event.22  -66.80520  -802.848  -449.986
#> Event.12 -718.76100 -1400.900 -1064.410

zz <- BCAD_to_BP(events)

## Plot events
plot(events, interval = "ci", calendar = "BCAD")

plot(events, interval = "hpdi", calendar = "BC")


## Compute phases
phases <- phase(events, groups = list(A = c(2, 4), B = c(1, 3)), ordered = TRUE)
summary(phases)

#> $A
#>                mean        sd      min         q1    median         q3
#> start    -1785.1618  98.79804 -1999.99 -1856.6800 -1784.640 -1719.0675
#> end      -1235.4825  86.02219 -1832.90 -1288.5175 -1235.055 -1180.8975
#> duration   549.6793 130.69325     4.20   462.9325   551.330   638.2125
#>                max CI_lower CI_upper
#> start    -1222.980 -1981.05 -1610.60
#> end       -718.761 -1403.84 -1067.44
#> duration  1156.261   296.28   804.95
#> 
#> $B
#>               mean       sd       min        q1    median        q3        max
#> start    -772.9709 147.1085 -1348.660 -889.6788 -749.3505 -671.3958 -206.69900
#> end      -521.0175 167.8882 -1049.560 -670.4143 -536.9485 -383.5560   -5.14937
#> duration  251.9534 136.6735     0.004  149.9530  247.9470  343.9115  878.74200
#>           CI_lower CI_upper
#> start    -1059.010 -501.118
#> end       -775.518 -214.316
#> duration     0.246  485.952
#> 

## Plot phases
plot(phases, succession = FALSE, calendar = "BCAD")

plot(phases, succession = TRUE, calendar = "BP")
